name: Path N
title: Pathological N
notes:
**Note 1:** Histological examination of a regional lymphadenectomy specimen will ordinarily include 12 or more lymph nodes. If the lymph nodes are negative, but the number ordinarily examined is not met. classify as pN0. 

**Note 2:**  Code only regional nodes and nodes, NOS, in this field.  Distant nodes are coded in metastasis.

**Note 3:**  Inferior mesenteric nodes are coded in distant metastasis for cecum, ascending colon, transverse colon, and hepatic flexure .  Superior mesenteric nodes are coded in distant metastasis for all colon sites.  Mesenteric node(s), NOS are coded in regional lymph nodes (N).

**Note 4:**  Regional lymph node involvement is rare for GISTs, so that cases in which the nodal status is not associated clinically or pathologically could be considered N0 instead of NX or pNX.

**Regional lymph nodes for colon**
 
**All colon sites** 

    Colic [NOS] 
    Epicolic (adjacent to bowel wall) 
    Mesocolic [NOS] 
    Mesenteric [NOS]
    Paracolic/pericolic

**Cecum (C180)** 

    Anterior (prececal), 
    Cecal [NOS]
    Ileocolic
    Periappendiceal
    Posterior (retrocecal)
    Right colic 

**Ascending colon (C182)** 

    Ileocolic
    Middle colic
    Right colic

**Hepatic flexure (C183)** 

    Middle colic 
    Right colic

**Transverse colon (C184)** 

    Inferior mesenteric 
    Left colic 
    Middle colic 
    Right colic

**Splenic flexure (C185)** 

    Inferior mesenteric 
    Left colic 
    Middle colic

**Descending colon (C186)** 

    Inferior mesenteric 
    Left colic 
    Sigmoid 

**Sigmoid colon (C187)** 

    Inferior mesenteric 
    Left colic 
    Rectosigmoid 
    Sigmoid 
    Sigmoidal (sigmoid mesenteric) 
    Superior hemorrhoidal 
    Superior rectal
